reviews.review_msg: seems nice enough, but BEWARE 355 is ENTIRELY about electric vehicles, name of course is very misleading. Zero material on urban and transit topics. all readings provided written by prof as well which felt restricting. Content felt contradictory as we're talking about sustainable options, yet alluded towards everyone buying an EV. sustainable!?

Axsen is great the class was something that i really enjoyed. There was lots to cover so lectures feel dense in material. I did not like having to do a final paper and a final exam just pick one please. Other then that I would highly recommend REM 355.

Good professor. Lectures are a bit dull but the material is interesting. Fair midterm and final. Marking was also fair by the TA. Easy paper and group project. Lots of easy marks for participation, journal entries and discussion board. Not sure how he is through email as I've only contacted the TA through there. Seems like a good guy though.

Monotone lectures, and emailing him his tone in said email comes off as not caring. Won't easily accommodate for things out of your control. Lectures are very heavy on content and builds up on one another. I learned more on YouTube than I did his lectures.

Axsen is a pretty good prof overall. His lectures can be a bit dull, but his slides are clear. The content is interesting but can be challenging if you struggle with or don't know economics. The exams in this class are really straightforward and very fair (usually MC and short+long answers). The papers are a bit harder, but you can work in a pair.

Kind, accommodates to students' needs, very clear on what he expects from students, and makes difficult class concepts easy and fun to learn. I can tell he is passionate about teaching about this stuff and that he really wants everyone to be happy. 10/10 would take again! And you should too!

He doesn't want to be bothered by students email. He tells you to contact your TA's instead, so he seems a bit rude and uncaring. Lectures are Heavy with ALOT of content. First midterm had 9 chapters. Also many extra articles to read which are long and some are hard to understand.
Enjoyed his lectures, he's a great instructor. His midterm was fair. iclicker questions for every class.
